Fundamentally a good game to play with friends and often randomers too. You're either: a hunter in which case you chase 4 survivors around madly hoping to cut them down and then carry them to a hook, or you're a survivor, in which case you dash from generator to generator fixing them while trying to stay undetected in the mists.
The skill matching can be a bit off, I've had very mismatched games which can be annoying after a few in a row. But eventually you'll get a well matched game, and that is very good fun - even if it doesn't end in your favour.

I play this to one day become Otzdarva.

Despite a lot of people's views about this game, including long time players, this is a fun an engaging game that can be really tense, or calming. There is a great sense of accomplishment, and the challenges are not easy, but are not impossible. There's always something to do and explore in Dead By Daylight.

REGARDING MATCHMAKING
I do want to point out there is not much the devs can do to fix matchmaking. I will be covering this topic eventually on my Twitch (TT/Lady_of_all_Cards) and the VOD will be posted on my YT Gaming channel (Lady of all Games). It's a big topic, but people play this game for fun and for certain OG characters, such as Micheal Myers and Ghost Face, so technical talk usually passes by, or they don't understand the somewhat extensive mechanics of matchmaking. I ask that you don't let negative views of the matchmaking turn you from the game because it really can be fun ^-^

4 Survivors try to escape one killer by repairing generators that power the exit doors. The Killer needs to hit the survivors and hook them three times until they are dead, while 5 gens need to be repaired by the survivors. The killer has a faster movement speed than the survivors and/or other weapons (like hatchets that can be thrown or traps) and sooner or later will always win the chase against a survivor. That's the intended way and is balanced as long as all survivors work together repairing gens and as long as the killer "equally balances" these chases and does not focus on one survivor only to get one out of the game early (which is also called "tunneling"). The survivors need the time to repair the generators, but if they are constantly busy with rescuing their teammates they cannot achieve this. Against tunneling killers there aren't a lot of counter-measures available and even the developers clearly state that tunneling is one possible way to play killer. For survivor camping and tunneling campers are worst because survivors need to spend a lot of time to find a proper way how to distract the killer while another survivor can go for the unhook. In worst case you just trade your survivor life for the other one. Especially if you go for solo queue (meaning that three other players are randomly assigned to you). Many of these random players don't focus on repairing gens (which is the only objective to win against the killer), but other things like doing challenges, destroying dull totems or sneaking around opening chest, etc. You also don't have voice chat so you cannot agree on a common strategy or pass on the killer's position to the other survivors in game. Instead you will need to take "information perks" with you that for example reveal the killer's position to you (like the perk "Kindred"). The developers even changed the way the anti-tunneling perk "decisive strike" works, so another advantage for tunneling killers. Other perks like "dead hard" seldomly work correctly and are never fixed (most times I find myself lying on the ground being "exhausted", so dead hard triggered, but did not protect me from the hit). Similar to throwing pallets. You successfully stun the killer, but the killer hits you nevertheless.
Another thing is that the statistics show that some type of killers are overpowered and have an average kill rate of 75%. That means that a survivor escapes (= wins) only every fourth game and dies in all the other games. That's very unsatisfying and not balanced at all. So overall this game is just frustrating for survivors in solo queue (which I mainly play) and they promise to rework the matchmaking a long time ago, but never actually did. So in my opinion the sweaty 4Kills/game killers should be matched with SWF all the time while solo queue players are matched with easier killers. Or solo queue survivors should see auras by default, so to compensate that they have no way to communicate with each other.
